DataElement.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance N-Methyl-D-Aspartate Receptor Antagonist Use Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No indicator related to use of NMDA receptor antagonist

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance N-Methyl-D-Aspartate Receptor Antagonist Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to use of NMDA receptor antagonist

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic substance including endogenous body substance used to diagnose, prevent, maintain, treat or analyze abnormal and normal biological functions in vivo or in vitro.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.

Property.preferredDefinition: A protein complex that plays a role in both NMDA binding and ion transport. It is a heterotetramer consisting of 2 glutamate [NMDA] receptor subunit zeta-1 proteins and 2 epsilon subunits (glutamate [NMDA] receptor subunit epsilon-1, -2, -3 or -4).:In medicine, a substance that stops the action or effect of another substance. For example, a drug that blocks the stimulating effect of estrogen on a tumor cell is called an estrogen receptor antagonist.:A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: A protein complex that plays a role in both NMDA binding and ion transport. It is a heterotetramer consisting of 2 glutamate [NMDA] receptor subunit zeta-1 proteins and 2 epsilon subunits (glutamate [NMDA] receptor subunit epsilon-1, -2, -3 or -4).

In medicine, a substance that stops the action or effect of another substance. For example, a drug that blocks the stimulating effect of estrogen on a tumor cell is called an estrogen receptor antagonist.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
